alert.note: Alert for Chatham (Georgia) Issued by the National Weather Service

info.senderName: NWS Charleston (the Southern end of South Carolina and Eastern Georgia)
info.headline: Flood Advisory issued July 14 at 6:55PM EDT by NWS Charleston
info.description: ...FLOOD ADVISORY REMAINS IN EFFECT UNTIL 745 PM EDT THIS EVENING... * WHAT...Flooding caused by excessive rainfall continues. * WHERE...A portion of southeast Georgia, including the following county, Chatham. * WHEN...Until 745 PM EDT. * IMPACTS...Minor flooding in low-lying and poor drainage areas. Overflowing poor drainage areas. Ponding of water in urban or other areas is occurring or is imminent. * ADDITIONAL DETAILS... - At 652 PM EDT, Doppler radar indicated a large area of thunderstorms with torrential rainfall impacting much of northern Chatham County. Nearly 3 inches of rain has fallen at the Savannah International Airport, setting a new daily rainfall record for the day. Between 2 and 3 inches have fallen over the northern parts of the county, highest near Port Wentworth. Urban and minor flooding of low-lying and poor drainage ares is in progress and will continue through at least 745 PM as storms slowly weaken over the area. Remain alert for flooded roadways. - Some locations that will experience flooding include... Pooler, I-16/I-95 Interchange, Savannah International Airport, Godley Station, Garden City, Port Wentworth, Bloomingdale, Meinhard, Monteith, Williams, Tutens, Hamer and Wheat Hill.
info.instruction: Turn around, don`t drown when encountering flooded roads. Most flood deaths occur in vehicles.
